_meta.description: Universal field dictionary for Japanese government forms. Each field is translated once and referenced by form templates via field_id.

confidence_levels.draft: Machine-translated or best guess — needs verification
confidence_levels.reviewed: Reviewed by someone with Japanese ability
confidence_levels.verified: Confirmed against official English materials or by native speaker
confidence_levels.official: Taken directly from an official government English translation

shimei.tip_en: Write in katakana for foreign names. Some forms accept romaji.
shimei.tip_ja: 外国人はカタカナで記入
shimei.notes: Also written as お名前 (onamae) on less formal forms

furigana.tip_en: Write the katakana reading of your name. For foreign names, this IS your name in katakana.
furigana.notes: Sometimes shown in hiragana (ふりがな) — same purpose, use katakana for foreign names either way

jusho.tip_en: Write in kanji if possible. Ward office staff can help you look up the correct kanji for your address.

gen_jusho.tip_en: Your address as currently registered. Same as 住所 on most forms.

shin_jusho.tip_en: The address you are moving TO.

kyu_jusho.tip_en: If coming from abroad, write your country name (e.g. アメリカ合衆国).

katagaki.tip_en: Apartment/mansion name and room number. e.g. ○○マンション 301号室

seinengappi.tip_en: Format: 年(year) 月(month) 日(day). Use Japanese calendar (令和/平成) or Western year.

seibetsu.tip_en: 男 (otoko) = Male, 女 (onna) = Female. Circle the appropriate one.

denwa_bango.tip_en: Japanese mobile number preferred. Some forms accept overseas numbers.

kokuseki.tip_en: Write your country of nationality. For Taiwan, write 台湾.

setainushi_shimei.reading: せたいぬし しめい
setainushi_shimei.tip_en: If you live alone, YOU are the head of household — write your own name.

todokede_bi.tip_en: Today's date. Use Japanese calendar or Western calendar.

ido_bi.tip_en: The date you actually moved into your new address — NOT your arrival date in Japan if different.

tennyu.english: Moving in (from another municipality or abroad)

setai_henko.english: Change of household (head of household change, merge, split)

zairyu_card_bango.reading: ざいりゅうカードばんごう
zairyu_card_bango.tip_en: Alphanumeric code on the front of your Residence Card (Zairyu Card).

zairyu_shikaku.tip_en: e.g. 技術・人文知識・国際業務, 日本人の配偶者等, 留学, 永住者

zairyu_kikan.tip_en: e.g. 1年, 3年, 5年. As shown on your Residence Card.

kojin_bango.tip_en: 12-digit number. Leave blank on first registration — it will be mailed to you after.

shomei.tip_en: Sign your name. Foreigners can use a written signature instead of a seal (inkan).

in.tip_en: Personal seal stamp. Most ward offices accept a written signature for foreigners instead.

todokedenin.tip_en: The person physically submitting the form. Usually yourself.

ininjou.english: Letter of proxy / Power of attorney
ininjou.tip_en: Required if someone else is filing on your behalf.

kinmusaki.tip_en: Company name and address. Some forms also ask for 勤務先電話番号 (employer phone number).

shokugyo.tip_en: e.g. 会社員 (company employee), 自営業 (self-employed), 学生 (student)

koza_meigi.tip_en: Must match the name on the account exactly — usually in katakana.

koza_shurui.tip_en: Most foreigners open 普通預金 (ordinary savings). Circle the correct type.

anshobango.tip_en: Choose a 4-digit PIN for your cash card. Avoid birthdays — banks may reject obvious numbers.

riyou_mokuteki.tip_en: Common answers: 給与受取 (salary deposit), 生活費 (living expenses), 貯蓄 (savings). Be specific — vague answers can delay approval.

給与受取.reading: きゅうよ うけとり

公共料金支払.reading: こうきょう りょうきん しはらい

tsuchou.tip_en: Physical booklet that records transactions. Some banks now offer passbook-free (通帳なし) digital-only accounts.

kyasshu_kaado.tip_en: Usually mailed to your registered address 1-2 weeks after opening. Some banks issue on the spot.

hoken_shosho.tip_en: Japanese health insurance card. Can serve as secondary ID at some banks.

houjin_mei.tip_en: Must exactly match the company name registered with the Legal Affairs Bureau.

daihyo_torishimariyaku.reading: だいひょう とりしまりやく
daihyo_torishimariyaku.tip_en: The person authorized to sign on behalf of the company. Must have Japanese residency for most banks.

houjin_bangou.tip_en: Assigned after company registration. Lookup at houjin-bangou.nta.go.jp

teikan.tip_en: Certified copy from the notary public. Must be notarized for KK; not required for GK.

touroku_jihkou_shoumeisho.reading: とうきじこうしょうめいしょ
touroku_jihkou_shoumeisho.english: Certificate of Registered Matters (company registry extract)
touroku_jihkou_shoumeisho.tip_en: Issued by the Legal Affairs Bureau (法務局). Must be from the last 6 months. ¥480-600.

houjin_inkan_shoumeisho.reading: ほうじん いんかん しょうめいしょ
houjin_inkan_shoumeisho.tip_en: Proves the company's official seal (代表印) is registered. Issued by Legal Affairs Bureau. ¥450.

jigyou_naiyo.tip_en: What your company does. Must match what's in your Articles of Incorporation.

shihon_kin.tip_en: Business Manager visa requires ¥5M minimum (¥30M from Oct 2025). Amount on your registry certificate.

honten_jusho.reading: ほんてん しょざいち
honten_jusho.tip_en: Must match the address in your company registration. Virtual offices may be rejected by banks.

torihiki_tantousha.reading: とりひき たんとうしゃ
torihiki_tantousha.english: Person in charge of transactions / Account officer
torihiki_tantousha.tip_en: Person who will actually operate the account day-to-day. Often the representative director for small companies.

jittai_shoyuusha.reading: じったいてき しはいしゃ
jittai_shoyuusha.tip_en: Any individual holding 25%+ of shares or voting rights. Required for anti-money-laundering compliance.

kiso_nenkin_bango.reading: きそねんきんばんごう
kiso_nenkin_bango.tip_en: 10-digit number on your Pension Handbook (年金手帳) or Basic Pension Number Notice. Format: 4 digits + 6 digits.

nenkin_techo_kigou_bango.reading: ねんきんてちょう きごうばんごう
nenkin_techo_kigou_bango.tip_en: Symbol number printed in your Pension Handbook. Can be left blank if you only have the Basic Pension Number.

kaigai_jusho.tip_en: Your address outside Japan where JPS can reach you by mail. Write in roman letters. Must be reliable — JPS communicates only by post.

ginko_mei.tip_en: Full official name of your bank. For overseas banks, write in English (e.g. 'Wells Fargo Bank').

shiten_mei.tip_en: Bank branch name and full address. For overseas banks, include the branch address.

swift_code.tip_en: 8 or 11 character code identifying your bank internationally. Required for overseas transfers. Find it on your bank's website or statements.

iban.tip_en: International Bank Account Number. Required for European banks. US, Australia, and Japan do not use IBAN — leave blank if not applicable.

seikyuu_ishi_kakunin.reading: せいきゅうのいしかくにん
seikyuu_ishi_kakunin.tip_en: Circle '請求する' (I claim). This acknowledges that claiming forfeits your pension enrollment period permanently — it cannot be used for totalization.

honnin_kakunin_shorui.reading: ほんにんかくにんしょるい
honnin_kakunin_shorui.tip_en: Documents that prove your identity. Primary: Residence Card, Passport, My Number Card. Secondary: Health Insurance Card, Driver's License.

ido_kubun.tip_en: Circle the type of move: 転入 (moving in), 転出 (moving out), 転居 (within municipality).

setainushi.tip_en: The primary person in a household for registration purposes. If you live alone, you are the head of household.

yuso_todokede_yo.reading: ゆうそうとどけでよう
yuso_todokede_yo.tip_en: Indicates this form or section is for mailing in. Follow postal submission instructions carefully.

tenshutsu_shomeisho.reading: てんしゅつしょうめいしょ
tenshutsu_shomeisho.tip_en: Document issued by your previous ward when you move out. Required when registering at your new ward (転入届).

my_number_card.tip_en: Plastic IC card with your 12-digit Individual Number. Can be used as primary ID. Apply at your ward office after receiving the notification letter.

zairyu_card.tip_en: ID card for foreign residents with mid- to long-term visas. Issued at the airport or immigration office. Must carry at all times.

biko.tip_en: Space for additional information or special circumstances. Usually optional.

kinyu_rei.english: Example of how to fill in
kinyu_rei.tip_en: Sample form showing how to complete each field. Study this before filling your own form.

shokuinran.reading: しょくいんきにゅうらん
shokuinran.english: Staff use only / Office use only
shokuinran.tip_en: Section for ward office staff. Do not write anything here.

kokumin_kenko_hoken.reading: こくみんけんこうほけん
kokumin_kenko_hoken.tip_en: Japan's public health insurance for self-employed, unemployed, and those not covered by employer insurance. Enrollment is mandatory.

kokumin_nenkin.tip_en: Japan's basic pension system. Mandatory for residents aged 20-59. Monthly premium ~¥16,980.

kaigo_hoken.tip_en: Insurance for elderly care services. Mandatory for residents 40+. Premiums deducted with health insurance.

kouki_koreisha.tip_en: Medical insurance category for those 75 and older. Different system from regular National Health Insurance.

juminhyo_code.reading: じゅうみんひょうコード
juminhyo_code.tip_en: 11-digit code assigned to each resident. Different from My Number. Usually not needed by applicants.

honten.tip_en: Where your family register (戸籍) is kept. For foreigners, write your nationality instead.

hittousha.tip_en: First person listed in the family register. For foreigners, this field is often N/A.

idou_jiyu.english: Reason for change / Type of move
idou_jiyu.tip_en: Why you are filing this notification (moving in, moving out, address change within municipality).

uketsuke.tip_en: Staff use - indicates form was received. Do not fill in.

shori.tip_en: Staff use - processing status. Do not fill in.

nyuryoku.tip_en: Staff use - data entry field. Do not fill in.

shougou.tip_en: Staff use - verification field. Do not fill in.

tenkyo_rei.reading: てんきょとどけきさいれい
tenkyo_rei.tip_en: This is a sample form showing how to fill out the address change notification.

gakumu.tip_en: Related to school enrollment. Staff will update school district records if you have children.

shogai_fukushi.tip_en: Abbreviation for 障害者福祉 (disability welfare). Staff use for updating disability services records.

auto_a0b6b4da.kanji: (アパート・マンション名、室番号など）
